importantArticles.headline: American Airlines said on Tuesday it will provide free high-speed in-flight internet services beginning in January 2026 in partnership with AT&T.  Free onboard internet access has become a key battleground for airlines as they chase high-value loyal customers.  Two years ago, Delta Air Lines began offering free wireless internet to members of its frequent-flyer program.
importantArticles.title: American Airlines to start offering free in-flight Wi-Fi next year

importantArticles.headline: Free high-speed Wi-Fi available exclusively to AAdvantage members beginning in January 2026 on more planes than any other domestic carrierDALLAS and FORT WORTH, Texas, April 15, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- American Airlines and AT&T — two iconic American brands built on a legacy of connecting customers to the people and places that matter most — will take those connections to new heights, offering complimentary inflight Wi-Fi¹ across more than 2 million American flights a year, beginning in January
importantArticles.title: Connecting the world: American Airlines to provide complimentary inflight Wi-Fi, sponsored by AT&T

importantArticles.headline: The deal with AT will provide free in-flight internet to loyalty program members, beginning in January.
importantArticles.title: American Airlines to Provide Free Wi-Fi, Joining Race to Court Connected Travelers

importantArticles.headline: American Airlines will soon offer free Wi-Fi on most of its flights, becoming the latest major carrier to add the perk.
importantArticles.title: American Airlines, last of the major carriers, is adding free Wi-Fi

importantArticles.headline: Brad Smith takes a closer look at the trending stories on Wall Street as part of today's Market Minute. Netflix (NFLX) stock gains on reports the company is aiming for a $1 trillion market capitalization and to double revenue by 2030. American Airlines (AAL) is partnering with AT&T (T) to offer AAdvantage members free in-flight wi-fi. HPE (HPE) is in focus as activist investor Elliott Management builds a $1.5 billion stake in the company, according to reports. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
importantArticles.title: Netflix wants to double sales, American Air free wi-fi, HPE & Elliott

importantArticles.headline: American Airlines said Tuesday that it will introduce free Wi-Fi for its "AAdvantage" rewards members starting in January 2026.
importantArticles.title: American Airlines to Launch Free Wi-Fi for Rewards Members in 2026

importantArticles.headline: FORT WORTH, Texas, April 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- American Airlines Group (NASDAQ: AAL) will webcast a live audio feed of its first-quarter 2025 financial results conference call with financial analysts and journalists Thursday, April 24, at 7:30 a.m. CT. The webcast will be available to the public on a listen-only basis at aa.com/investorrelations. An archive of the call will be available on the website through May 24. importantArticles.headline: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after markets rallied sharply on news that President Trump announced a 90-day tariff pause. Reciprocal tariffs were also dropped to 10% for most countries, sparking renewed optimism amid ongoing trade talks. The major stock indices rose as investors, growing impatient of seemingly irrational tariff actions, welcomed the pause as a sign of a more measured path forward.
importantArticles.title: Lucid (LCID) and American Airlines (AAL), Delta Air Lines (DAL), Ford (F), Rivian (RIVN) Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know

importantArticles.headline: American Airlines Group (NasdaqGS:AAL) has recently appointed Tony Richmond as Executive Vice President. While this leadership enhancement signifies the company's robust focus on legal and corporate governance, American Airlines stock fell 11.94% over the past week. This decline aligns with a broader market trend marked by heightened volatility and fears of economic slowdown due to new tariffs. The airline sector, although benefiting from Delta’s favorable earnings report, faces headwinds...
importantArticles.title: American Airlines Group (NasdaqGS:AAL) Sees 12% Price Drop Over Last Week

importantArticles.headline: Delta Air Lines delivered a beat on earnings per share while revenues missed analyst expectations as elements from a "slower-growth" Q1 clouded the airline's full-year guidance.
importantArticles.title: Delta stock pops after earnings beat, 'murky' outlook amid tariff uncertainty

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- Goldman Sachs has taken a cautious outlook for U.S. airlines, warning that softening demand and rising economic uncertainty will weigh on the sector through 2025, and downgraded American Airlines (NASDAQ:AAL) to Sell from Neutral. Meanwhile, the brokerage upgraded SkyWest (NASDAQ:SKYW) to Buy, citing its relative insulation from the broader downturn.
importantArticles.title: Goldman downgrades American Airlines to Sell, upgrades SkyWest to Buy
